Whether you're seeking a holiday home, permanent residence, or investment property, EVO VILLAS offers exceptional value in an established international community where English is widely spoken and comprehensive amenities are abundant.

The area is renowned for its welcoming atmosphere, with established English-speaking networks and international schools making relocation seamless. Golf enthusiasts appreciate the proximity to several championship courses, while culture and cuisine remain central to daily life in this vibrant corner of the Costa Blanca.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. Non-EU citizens may need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), but this is a straightforward process. Spanish law does not discriminate between Spanish citizens and foreign buyers. Our team can guide you through the legal requirements and documentation needed for your purchase.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the property price, typical costs include transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), registry fees (0.1-0.5%), and legal fees (typically 1-2%). For EVO VILLAS in Alicante, plan for approximately 8-12% additional costs on top of the €385,000 purchase price. We recommend obtaining a detailed cost breakdown from a local solicitor.
